bug.short_desc: lmtpd loops and corrupts database under certain error conditions

long_desc.thetext:
When lmtpd fails to exec() sendmail while processing a sieve script, the lmtpd can go into a loop blocking other deliveries and leaving the mailbox database in a corrupt state when killed. The reason is that the child forked to exec sendmail is wrongly calling error handling code which tries to shut down the database connection instead of just exiting with a error status.
We've got hit by this with cyrus-imapd-2.4.2 last week, but the bug still exists in the current version 2.4.8. The bug was already analyzed, and reported 2007 by Jesús Roncero together with a valid fix, but it must have slipped the attention of the maintainers.
Original report: http://www.spinics.net/lists/info-cyrus/msg03554.html
